meta.purpose: UI/UX mockup for a TV show detail page with immersive hero, metadata, seasons, and cast information
meta.notes_for_model: This is the deep-dive into a specific TV show - showcasing all metadata, seasons, cast, and providing actions like scheduling and progress tracking. It should feel like opening a premium Blu-ray case or reading a film magazine feature spread.

story.one_sentence_brief: An immersive show detail page featuring a cinematic hero section with backdrop image and poster, show metadata and overview, a sticky action bar with progress tracking and watch buttons, followed by tabbed content sections for Seasons (episode grid), Cast & Crew, and Details.
story.additional_context: This is where users explore everything about a show before deciding what to watch. The design needs to celebrate the show's imagery while providing comprehensive information and easy actions.

scene.subject: A full show detail page with a large hero section (60% viewport height) showing a cinematic TV show backdrop with heavy gradient overlay. In the hero, a show poster is displayed on the left (200x300px) with the show title, year, rating, seasons count, and overview text on the right. Below the hero is a sticky action bar showing current episode progress with 'Mark Watched' and 'Add to Schedule' buttons. Below that are tabs (Seasons | Cast & Crew | Details) with an episode grid visible in the default Seasons tab.
secondary_subjects: Show poster with gold border accent
Meta badges (year, TV-MA rating, 5 Seasons, 45 min)
Streaming provider logos showing where to watch
Episode cards in a grid showing still images, episode numbers in gold circles, titles and descriptions
Cast section preview with actor headshots
scene.action: Static UI mockup showing the show detail page with hero, action bar, and Seasons tab content visible
scene.location: Digital web browser frame showing the show detail page at desktop resolution
scene.time_of_day: The hero image sets the mood - could be any scene from the show
scene.mood: Informative yet cinematic, like reading a premium entertainment magazine profile - appreciation and anticipation

composition.shot_type: Full page screenshot/mockup view showing the complete show detail page
composition.framing: Hero section dominates top portion with poster on left and info on right. Action bar sits below hero. Tab content fills remaining space with episode grid visible.

style.medium: High-fidelity digital UI design mockup with cinematic imagery integration
style.era_or_reference: IMDB meets high-end streaming service detail page - comprehensive information with magazine-quality presentation
style.color_palette: Backdrop image with heavy gradient to deep night (#0D0F14), cinema gold accents (#D4A853) for buttons and episode number badges, elevated surface (#1C2230) for episode cards, warm white text, muted cream for secondary info

lighting.description: Hero backdrop provides scene lighting, heavily muted by gradient overlay. Poster has subtle shadow. Episode cards have consistent lighting from their still images. Action bar has glass effect with blur.
lighting.color_and_contrast: Hero image desaturated to 80% to not compete with UI. High contrast text over gradients. Gold elements provide accent and call-to-action prominence.

format.surface_or_output: Desktop web browser mockup at 1920x1080 or higher, suitable for design presentation

constraints.factual_accuracy: UI elements should be properly aligned. Episode grid should show proper card layout. Tab interface should look functional. Progress indicators should be realistic.
constraints.safety_and_rights: Use generic/conceptual TV show imagery, not real show backdrops or posters. Actor faces should be generic silhouettes or avoid faces entirely.
negative_elements: no missing gradient protections for text
